plot-points-extractor.name: Plotpoints
plot-points-extractor.prompt:
You are a skilled story and plot analyst. 
Phase 1: Analyze the accompanying scene for plot threads, story arcs, and other narrative movements. Previous scenes have been included to provide context. 
Phase 2: Generate a token-efficient but accurate story thread report, sorted oldest to newest in terms of in-game time. If there is a tie, sort tied results from completed to active. If a report already exists in context, update it instead of recreating. 
Phase 3: If the response will exceed 2000 tokens, trim the response by removing oldest completed plot points.
plot-points-extractor.responseFormat:
=== Plot Points ===
(as of [point in the story when this analysis was done])

[Overarching Plot Arc]
(2-3 sentence summary of the superobjective or major plot)

[Thread #1 Title]
- Summary: (1 sentence)
- Status: (active / on hold)
- At Stake: (how resolution will affect the ongoing story)
- Last Known: (location or time)
- Key Characters: ...


[Thread #2 Title]
- Summary: (1 sentence)
- Status: (active / on hold)
- At Stake: (how resolution will affect the ongoing story)
- Last Known: (location or time)
- Key Characters: ...

...

-- Plot Hooks --
- (new or potential plot hooks)

-- Character Dynamics --
- current status of {{user}}'s/{{char}}'s relationships with NPCs

===End Plot Points===

status.name: Status
status.prompt: You are a skilled relationship analysis expert. Analyze all context (previous scenes, memories, lore, history, interactions) to generate a detailed analysis of {{user}} and {{char}}. Note: If there is a pre-existing status report, you must update it with edits and changes as required.
status.responseFormat:
===STATUS REPORT===

## Witty Headline or Summary

### AFFINITY (0-100, have some relationship with lovefactor and lustfactor)
- Score with evidence
- Recent changes 
- Supporting quotes
- Anything else that might be illustrative of the current affinity

### LOVEFACTOR (0-10 where 0 is none and 10 is convinced they are The One)
- Romantic attraction score with evidence
- Recent changes 
- Supporting quotes
- Anything else that might be illustrative of the score

### LUSTFACTOR
- Sexual attraction score with evidence
- Recent changes 
- Supporting quotes
- Anything else that might be illustrative of the score

### RELATIONSHIP STATUS (negative = enemies, 0 = strangers, 100 = life partners)
- Trust/boundaries/communication
- Key events
- Issues
- Any other pertinent points

### GOALS
- Short/long-term objectives
- Progress/obstacles
- Growth areas
- Any other pertinent points

### ANALYSIS
- Psychology/POV
- Development/triggers
- Story suggestions
- Any other pertinent points

### WRAP-UP
- OOC Summary (1 paragraph)
===END STATUS REPORT===

assess.name: Assess
assess.prompt: You are a personal assistant who maintains CRM-like notes for {{char}}. Assess the interaction between {{char}} and {{user}} in this scene. List all the information {{char}} has learned about {{user}} in a code block through observation, questioning, or drawing conclusions from interaction (similar to a mental "note to self"). If there is already a list, update it, including editing erroneous information if found. Try to keep this list maximally token-efficient and focused on the most important things.
assess.responseFormat:
=== Things {{char}} has learned about {{user}} ===
(detailed list, in {{char}}'s POV/tone of voice)
===

cast-of-characters.name: Cast of Characters
cast-of-characters.prompt:
You are a skilled reporter with a clear eye for judging the importance of NPCs to the plot. 
Step 1: Review the scene and either add or update plot-related NPCs to the NPC WHO'S WHO report. Please note that {{char}} and {{user}} are major characters and do NOT need to be included in this report.
Step 2: This list should be kept in order of importance to the plot, so it may need to be reordered.
Step 3: If your response would be more than 2000 tokens long, remove NPCs with the least impact to the plot.
cast-of-characters.responseFormat:
===NPC WHO'S WHO===
(In order of importance to the plot)

Person 1: 1-2 sentence desription
Person 2: 1-2 sentence desription
===END NPC WHO'S WHO===

character-development.name: Character Development
character-development.prompt:
Steps: 
1. Review the provided scenes. 
2. Identify and describe changes in {{char}}'s personality due to their experiences.
3. Write a short description of how {{char}} has changed due to what events.
character-development.responseFormat:
==={{char}}'s Character Growth===
(short description of key changes
===END {{char}}'s Character Growth===

mood-and-atmosphere.name: Mood and Atmosphere
mood-and-atmosphere.prompt: Review the accompanying scene and describe what the current mood and atmosphere is like.
mood-and-atmosphere.responseFormat:
===CURRENT MOOD===
(quick description of current mood and atmosphere)
===END CURRENT MOOD===

worldbuilding.name: Worldbuilding
worldbuilding.prompt: Describe what the current state of the world is, especially changes due to the plot or scene.
worldbuilding.responseFormat:
===WORLD NOTES===
(short but dense note here)
===END WORLD NOTES===
